item.title: The Four Factors: Statistics that Make College Basketball Teams Win
item.description: Calculates four factors for 30 NCAAMB teams from the 2019-2020 season. Teams are drawn from the 10 “high-major” conferences. Analysis features the use of linear regression to determine the importance of each factor. Results are compared to Dean Oliver and Wayne Winston’s NBA results. Data scraped from ESPN. Link to PDF Report Link to GitHub Repository

item.title: Analyzing Margot's Attempted Steal of Home
item.description: It’s World Series Game 5 with the series tied at 2. You’re standing on third with a teammate on first, you’re down by 1 in the bottom of the 4th with 2 outs, and future Hall of Famer Clayton Kershaw is on the mound. You’re a career 71% successful base stealer, and Kershaw’s back is to you as he brings his hands together above his head as he comes set. Do you steal home?

item.title: R Exercise: Simulating the 2020 MLB Regular Season and Postseason
item.description: Shows how to simulate the 2020 MLB regular season and postseason. Generates regular season and postseason results using the Bradley-Terry model, specifically utilizing Pythagorean win percentage as estimates of teams’ true talent levels. Strengths and weaknesses of the model are examined. Easily adaptable to other season formats. Link to PDF Report Link to GitHub Repository

item.title: R Exercise: Estimating the Exponent in Pythagorean Expectation
item.description: Presents a walkthrough of estimating the exponent in the Pythagorean expectation formula for win percentage. In this case, we use NBA data. Link to PDF Report Link to GitHub Repository

item.title: Stock Price Analysis Using Time Series!
item.description: Demonstrates data science life cycle in the following steps: EDA (visualizations) Transforming the data Removing the trend from the stock price data Fitting an ARIMA model to the residuals Selecting best model by cross validation Making and analyzing predictions.
